name: Tefillin
fullDescription: Tefillin (singular: tefilah; Greek-derived: phylacteries) are a set of two small black leather boxes containing handwritten scrolls inscribed with Torah verses. One box is worn on the upper arm (tefillin shel yad), positioned on the bicep facing the heart, while the other is worn on the head (tefillin shel rosh), centered above the hairline between the eyes. Black leather straps (retzuot) secure the boxes in place.
